Meetings & Events at Callaway
Callaway Resort & Gardens, a stunning destination in the Southernmost foothills of the Appalachians, has been Georgia’s premier destination for corporate events, off-site meetings, group outings, and holiday parties for over 50 years. Conveniently located sixty miles Southwest of Atlanta, and just an hour from Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport, Callaway is a world away – with breathtaking natural scenery, world-class amenities, and elegant, inspired settings designed to help you connect.
Call
706-663-5179
to speak to the Sales Department.
Request More Information
Group Sales Promotions
Callaway Resort & Gardens is offering incentive options valid for Meetings & Events held over the following dates:
Summer:
June 16 - August 31, 2025
Fall:
September 26 - November 1, 2025
Winter:
January 1 - February 28, 2026
You may choose a Rebate on actualized guest rooms revenue, or select Concessions to enhance your event.
Events for Every Occasion
Meetings & Conferences
Organize a business meeting or team-building retreat attendees will be talking about for months.
Learn More
Weddings
Nestled in the foothills of the Appalachian, and only an hour from Atlanta, Callaway Resort and Gardens offers you and your guests the perfect destination wedding.
Learn More
Group Golf
Whether you prefer a more challenging course, Mountain View, or our more causal playing, scenic course, Lakeview, either are the perfect fit for your golf getaway. Bring your group together and enjoy the natural beauty of our courses!
Learn More
Social Gatherings
Make your get together a festive occasion worth celebrating at Callaway Resort & Gardens. We have a wide array of world-class venues and a collection of perfectly culinary crafted special banquet & holiday menus to suit your needs.
Learn More
Discovery Callaway Resort & Gardens for Your Next Meeting or Event

Support The Gardens
Make A Donation To Our Georgia Woodland Gardens
Your support of the Ida Cason Callaway Foundation helps Callaway Gardens continually flourish.
Inspired by those before us, the mission of the non-profit 501(c)3 Ida Cason Callaway Foundation is to connect people and nature in a way that benefits both. Using no state or federal funding, the Foundation is committed to bringing joy and light to people’s lives through:
Enrichment
- We preserve Callaway Gardens for future generations by creating an understanding of the natural world today through exhibits, demonstrations, workshops, internships, lectures, field trips, special events, and in-school workshops.
Recreation
- We encourage an appreciation for Georgia’s natural world by fostering discovery and play in the great outdoors.
Conservation
- By protecting Callaway Gardens’ historic woodlands and wildlife, we assure generations to come encounter the same wonder as generations before them.
Donate Today
If you prefer not to donate online, you can send a check (payable to the Ida Cason Callaway Foundation) to:
Ida Cason Callaway Foundation
100 Meadow View Lane
Pine Mountain, Georgia 31822
For more information about giving to the Ida Cason Callaway Foundation, please contact Carly Zikeli at 706.663.5105 or
czikeli@callawaygardens.com

Events
Callaway Gardens Events & Experiences
Awe-inspiring blossoms. Thrilling, world-class athletes and performers. And, of course, the greatest holiday light-and-sound tradition in the South. From festive outdoor activities to enchanting evenings under the stars, the Signature Events at Callaway Resort & Gardens are designed to whisk you away from the everyday – and make your stay unforgettable.
Events & Experiences
Activities
Resort
Callaway Cruiser
Mountain View Clubhouse
Our cruiser carts are the fun, stylish way to navigate Callaway Resort & Gardens. Choose from 4-Passenger and 6-Passenger carts to pick the perfect ride for you and your family.
Rentals
More Details
Gardens
Butterfly 101
Butterfly Center
Year-RoundWeekdays, 2 p.m.
Spanning the lifecycle of butterflies, what they eat, and where they come from, Butterfly 101 takes guests through an engaging presentation on all aspects of the Butterfly. Located in our theater area.
Free With Admission
More Details
Gardens
Organ Concerts
Ida Cason Callaway Memorial Chapel
Marvel as the majestic sounds of our custom-built Möller pipe organ ring out from this iconic building overlooking Falls Creek Lake. Stop in for a moment of serenity or enjoy the full concert inside or around the beloved Memorial Chapel.Chapel is closed to guests during Organ Concerts.
Free With Admission
More Details
Gardens
Birds of Prey
Discovery Center Amphitheater
Experience one of Callaway Gardens’ most talked about activities, featuring magnificent creatures demonstrating their strength and speed.
Free With Admission
More Details
Gardens
TreeTop Adventure Ziplines
TreeTop Adventure
With ten zip lines ranging from 44 to 700 feet in length, and other high-flying challenges deftly woven into the natural forest, TreeTop Adventure will take your love of nature to new heights!
Add-On Experience
More Details
Gardens
Bicycles
Discovery Center
Rental bikes and equipment are available daily, based on availability, at the Virginia Hand Callaway Discovery Center, and seasonally at the Beach Bike Barn.
Rentals
More Details
Resort
Gardens to Table Dinner Series
The Gardens to Table Dinner Series is an all-new dining experience, featuring an elaborate dinner with a unique theme and special guest speakers from across the culinary industry. Spots are limited for the Gardens to Table Dinner Series. Reservations are required.
More Details
Gardens
Boathouse
Callaway Outdoors & Boathouse operates daily year round (hours flex seasonally). This location offers jon boat rentals, canoes, kayaks, shore fishing, and private guided fishing excursions.
More Details
Gardens
Fishing & Boating
Some of the best fishing in the Southeastern United States is found right here, amidst the incomparable beauty of Callaway Resort & Gardens.
More Details
Gardens
Blue Morpho Butterfly Month
Butterfly Center
9/1/2025 — 9/30/2025
Enjoy our month-long display of nature at its finest! Marvel at the Blue Morpho as hundreds of these tropical butterflies fill the Cecil B. Day Butterfly Center with their iridescent-blue splendor all month long.
More Details
Beach
Pumpkins At Callaway
9/12/2025 — 11/1/2025
The gardens are aglow each fall during the bigger and brighter Pumpkins at Callaway.
More Details
Gardens
Butterfly Festival
Butterfly Center
9/27/2025 — 9/28/2025
Celebrate butterflies, caterpillars and all things crawly at our Butterfly Festival!  With crafts, games and activities for children of all ages (and kids at heart), the Cecil B. Day Tropical Butterfly Conservatory will be the hub of happenings all weekend long.
More Details
Beach
Fantasy In Lights Presented By Georgia Power
11/17/2025 — 12/30/2025
Celebrate a Callaway Resort & Gardens family tradition with 10 million twinkling lights and 2,500 acres of Christmas cheer!
More Details

Activities Bring your team together, foster morale, refine skills, and take in the inspiration that 2,500 acres of natural beauty and outdoor activities have to offer. Request Proposal Team Building The Callaway Team Challenge is a comprehensive team-building program with built-in flexibility to meet your group’s unique needs and objectives. It offers challenging but fun activities, each highly customizable and designed to help your group member outdoor pools refine their skills in leadership, communication, cooperation, encouragement, problem solving, and more. View Brochure Activities Callaway Resort & Gardens has a wealth of recreational offerings that go hand-in-hand with our surroundings. From sports to cultural exhibits to shopping, we offer the activities and programming expertise to ensure maximum fun and camaraderie for your group, as well as for spouses and families. Activities Places Shopping Trails Gardens Adopt-A-Raptor Discovery Center Adopting a resident raptor is a fun way to support our Birds of Prey program. Our Adopt-A-Raptor initiative enables you to help support the feeding, training, housing, husbandry, and medical care for one of our resident raptors. Donate More Details Gardens Bicycles Discovery Center Rental bikes and equipment are available daily, based on availability, at the Virginia Hand Callaway Discovery Center, and seasonally at the Beach Bike Barn. Rentals More Details Gardens Birds of Prey Discovery Center Amphitheater Experience one of Callaway Gardens’ most talked about activities, featuring magnificent creatures demonstrating their strength and speed. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Butterfly 101 Butterfly Center Year-RoundWeekdays, 2 p.m. Spanning the lifecycle of butterflies, what they eat, and where they come from, Butterfly 101 takes guests through an engaging presentation on all aspects of the Butterfly. Located in our theater area. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Callaway Brothers Azalea Bowl Callaway Brothers Azalea Bowl Home to more than 3,000 hybrid azaleas, this 40-acre hillside garden offers a network of peaceful walking paths to explore. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Callaway Brothers Azalea Bowl Trails Callaway Brothers Azalea Bowl Explore a vast network of foot trails designed to whisk you away to the very heart of Georgia’s natural wonder. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Callaway Discovery Center This ideal starting point for a tour of the Gardens is also a beautiful tribute to the memory of co-founder Virginia Hand Callaway; and home to our world-class Birds of Prey Program. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Callaway Outdoors Our fishing pro shop stocks an excellent variety of rods, reels, flies, clothing, accessories, gift items, and more. Located inside the Gardens. More Details Gardens Cecil B. Day Butterfly Center Butterfly Center Flights of fancy await you in the Cecil B. Day Butterfly Center, where typically 1,000 or more butterflies flutter freely about in one of North America’s largest tropical butterfly conservatories. Free With Admission More Details
 
Country Store The renowned Callaway Gardens Country Store, located just outside the Gardens on U.S. Hwy. 27 South, features signature grits and preserves, specialty food products, gift items, wine selections, and more in a historic building that dates back to the early 1950s. More Details Gardens Day Butterfly Center Gift Shop Butterfly Center The shelves are stocked with fun, butterfly-themed merchandise including jewelry, books, children’s toys, and more. Located in the Cecil B. Day Butterfly Center inside the Gardens. More Details Gardens Discovery Amphitheater Discovery Center The Discovery Amphitheater, where you can experience our Free-Flighted Birds of Prey Shows. More Details Gardens Discovery Bike Trail Discovery Center Explore the beauty of the entire property via two wheels on this meandering, paved ride. Free With Admission Rentals More Details Gardens Discovery Center Gift Shop Discovery Center Explore a wide array of intriguing, nature-related items for the home and the garden in this spacious store. Located in the Virginia Hand Callaway Discovery Center inside the Gardens. More Details Gardens Holly Trail Meadowlark Garden Located in Meadowlark Garden, the Holly Trail boasts one of the country’s largest displays of Asian and American holly collections and a picturesque gazebo along its .8-mile length. Nearby, the Thornhill Hydrangea Garden and large picnic area offer a serene environment for quiet reflection. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Ida Cason Callaway Memorial Chapel Built as a tribute to Cason Callaway’s mother, this magnificent house of worship features fieldstone quartz and nature-themed stained glass windows. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Trail Pioneer Log Cabin Trailhead located adjacent to Pioneer Log Cabin. This .6-mile Wildflower Trail, features many native plants of Georgia including many uncommon species. This shaded trail offers a gazebo, waterfall, small ponds, babbling stream, and a picturesque bridge overlooking Mountain Creek Lake. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Meadowlark Garden Take a peaceful stroll through one of the world's top 25 displays of Asian and American Holly, including the beautiful Holly Trail. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Mountain Creek Lake Trail Mountain Creek Lake This woodland path rambles 1.5 miles along the water’s edge, offering a glimpse at the diverse flora and wildlife, including turtles, fish, ducks, herons, and other aquatic residents. Two gazebos provide delightful spots to sit and enjoy the surroundings. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Nature Wildlife Callaway Resort & Gardens is home to an exciting world of flora and fauna. Discover the diverse species of birds and woodland animals you can spot at Callaway. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Organ Concerts Ida Cason Callaway Memorial Chapel Marvel as the majestic sounds of our custom-built Möller pipe organ ring out from this iconic building overlooking Falls Creek Lake. Stop in for a moment of serenity or enjoy the full concert inside or around the beloved Memorial Chapel.Chapel is closed to guests during Organ Concerts. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Overlook Azalea Garden Each Spring, thousands of shrubs explode into a kaleidoscope of vivid reds, pinks, purples, and whites. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Overlook Azalea Trail Overlook Azalea Garden This 1.6-mile path weaves through the Overlook Azalea Garden, a natural amphitheater whose namesake blooms explode with Spring color, and companion plantings offer additional color and texture throughout the year. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Pioneer Log Cabin The Pioneer Log Cabin dates to the early 19th century and offers a glimpse back into a simple but often difficult way of life. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Rhododendron Trail Butterfly Center This .6-mile route near the Day Butterfly Center highlights evergreen rhododendrons near the Southern limits of their range. A secluded sitting area offers an opportunity to observe waterfowl on Hummingbird Lake. Free With Admission More Details Gardens Thornhill Hydrangea Garden Before or after a visit to the Day Butterfly Center, take a walk through the Thornhill Hydrangea Garden, with its stunning, long-lasting blooms. Free With Admission More Details Gardens TreeTop Adventure Ziplines TreeTop Adventure With ten zip lines ranging from 44 to 700 feet in length, and other high-flying challenges deftly woven into the natural forest, TreeTop Adventure will take your love of nature to new heights! Add-On Experience More Details Gardens Whippoorwill Lake Trail Whippoorwill Lake Near the Overlook Azalea Garden, the .5-mile Whippoorwill Lake Trail hugs the water’s edge on one side and a woodland habitat on the other. Look for wood ducks nesting near the bridge. Free With Admission More Details Get The Latest News and Special Offers Subscribe to our newsletter, special offers and promotional emails. Connection Golf Membership
The Connection Golf membership grants access to Callaway Resort & Gardens for the Individual Member or for the Family Membership, two (2) adults and any dependents up to 24 years of age.
Individual
$184
Per Month
Family
$260
Per Month
*All dues and fees are subject to applicable sales tax and are subject to change. Must reside inside Callaway Resort & Gardens to obtain this membership.

- Full Golf privileges, including one round of golf per day on a space-available basis with 14-day advance tee times. Cart fee not included.
- Golf tournaments, organized golf leagues, and full Twin Oaks practice facility access. Range Balls included.
- Member Guest rates for both accompanied and unaccompanied guests.
- Automatic Payments are available for dues and member events. All Golf fees must be paid at the clubhouse.
- Unlimited General Admission to the beautiful Gardens including the Callaway Discovery Center, Cecil B. Day Butterfly Center, Callaway Brothers Azalea Bowl, Ida Cason Callaway Memorial Chapel, Birds of Prey show, Robin Lake Beach, Discovery Bicycle Trails, Overlook Azalea Garden, many walking trails.
- Admission to our Master’s Water Ski & Wakeboard Tournament on Memorial Day Weekend, the July 4th Extravaganza, and the Hot Air Balloon Festival over Labor Day Weekend.
- Member-only events and programs
- 30% Discount on Educational Workshops and select Callaway Gardens programs
- 50% Discount on any night of Fantasy in Lights (both levels). Prunifolia also receives six (6) free tickets
- 30% Discount on Bicycle Rentals, Fishing, Golf, Kayak Rentals, Tennis, and TreeTop Adventure
- 10% Discount in our Gift Shops
- 10% Discount in our Restaurants (Food Only)
- 15% Discount in Mountain View Golf Shop

Support The Gardens
Make A Donation To Our Georgia Woodland Gardens
Your support of the Ida Cason Callaway Foundation helps Callaway Gardens continually flourish.
Inspired by those before us, the mission of the non-profit 501(c)3 Ida Cason Callaway Foundation is to connect people and nature in a way that benefits both. Using no state or federal funding, the Foundation is committed to bringing joy and light to people’s lives through:
Enrichment
- We preserve Callaway Gardens for future generations by creating an understanding of the natural world today through exhibits, demonstrations, workshops, internships, lectures, field trips, special events, and in-school workshops.
Recreation
- We encourage an appreciation for Georgia’s natural world by fostering discovery and play in the great outdoors.
Conservation
- By protecting Callaway Gardens’ historic woodlands and wildlife, we assure generations to come encounter the same wonder as generations before them.
Donate Today
If you prefer not to donate online, you can send a check (payable to the Ida Cason Callaway Foundation) to:
Ida Cason Callaway Foundation
100 Meadow View Lane
Pine Mountain, Georgia 31822
For more information about giving to the Ida Cason Callaway Foundation, please contact Carly Zikeli at 706.663.5105 or
czikeli@callawaygardens.com
